name: Real Estate and the City
description: Operation of property markets; cities as markets in land and structures; stocks of property and flows of accommodation service; location of industry, offices and retailing within the city; rental and owner-occupied housing; depreciation and maintenance; cyclical behaviour in metropolitan property markets; impacts of local government; property taxation.
prerequisites: At least 1.5 credits at the B-level in ONE of the following: City Studies or Human Geography or Economics for Management Studies or Management
